overview: This subject examines the role of the media in the contemporary politics of Australia and similar countries. Topics covered include theories of the media in democratic politics, how news is manufactured, the power of news media to set the public and political agenda, the impact of television and media on politics, PR methods used by politicians and pressure groups to manage the media, and case-studies of how politics is represented.
ilo: Critically compare competing theoretical frameworks for understanding the function of news media, particularly in democratic states, and the political, cultural and socio-economic contexts in which they operate
Assess the influence of different interests in media construction of news
Critically evaluate media representations of political and social relations
Be familiar with theoretical and social scientific research approaches to the study of news media
Communicate effectively in oral and written formats.
